name: Shoving Match
text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."

editions.flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.

name: Show and Tell
text: Each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."
At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."
At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."

name: Shower of Coals
text:
Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three target creatures and/or players.
Threshold — Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those creatures and/or players instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Shower of Sparks
text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.
The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.
The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

name: Show of Valor
text: Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Duty, honor, and valor are either in your heart or they are not. You will never know for certain until you are tested."
—Ajani Goldmane
Cowards watch. Heroes act.

name: Showstopper
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "When this creature dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature an opponent controls."

editions.flavor: The audience quickly realized a few things: it wasn't a magic trick, there wasn't candy in there, and they'd need new clothes.

name: Shrapnel Blast
text:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: To the Krark Clan, every artifact has a trigger and a barrel.
It requires immense pressure to imbue an item with magic. If the spell is broken . . .
From trinket to trauma.
From trinket to trauma.

name: Shredding Winds
text: Shredding Winds deals 7 damage to target creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Enemies of the wood! Your presence here is a slap in Nylea's face. Do not be surprised if she slaps back."
—Telphe, druid of Nylea

name: Shred Memory
text:
Exile up to four target cards from a single graveyard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

name: Shreds of Sanity
text: Return up to one target instant card and up to one target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card. Exile Shreds of Sanity.

editions.flavor: A few gnawing thoughts can eat at the mind until nothing else remains.

name: Shrewd Hatchling
text:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

name: Shrewd Negotiation
text: Exchange control of target artifact you control and target artifact or creature you don't control.

editions.flavor: "Pleasure doing business with you."

name: Shriekgeist
text:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

name: Shriekhorn
text:
Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Shrieking Affliction
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has one or fewer cards in hand, he or she loses 3 life.

editions.flavor: A gargoyle's voice reaches pitches that will shatter glass and warp bone.

name: Shrieking Drake
text:
Flying
When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."
—Teferi

name: Shrieking Grotesque
text:
Flying
When Shrieking Grotesque enters the battlefield, if {B} was spent to cast it, target player discards a card.

editions.flavor: Orzhov mage-sculptors bring their stone to life before they carve it. The shrieking begins as soon as the mouths are formed.

name: Shrieking Mogg
text:
Haste
When Shrieking Mogg enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.

editions.flavor: You have to admire its enthusiasm.

name: Shrieking Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player discards a card.

name: Shriekmaw
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Shriekmaw enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
Evoke {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Shriek of Dread
text: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: When Crosis roared, the battle ended and the slaughter began.

name: Shriek Raptor
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor:
"That's no glint hawk. The skies have changed for the worse."
—Ria Ivor, White Sun partisan

name: Shrike Harpy
text:
Flying
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Shrike Harpy enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, target opponent sacrifices a creature.

name: Shrill Howler
text:
Creatures with power less than Shrill Howler's power can't block it.
{5}{G}: Transform Shrill Howler.

editions.flavor:
"A werewolf's howl is terrifying, to be sure. But this . . . this was a chilling sound I somehow felt. I fear what will reply to it."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Shrine of Boundless Growth
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a green spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Boundless Growth: Add {C} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.

name: Shrine of Burning Rage
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a red spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Burning Rage.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Burning Rage: Shrine of Burning Rage deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.

name: Shrine of Limitless Power
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a black spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Limitless Power: Target player discards a card for each charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.

name: Shrine of Loyal Legions
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a white spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Loyal Legions: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token for each charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.

name: Shrine of Piercing Vision
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a blue spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Piercing Vision.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Piercing Vision: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of charge counters on Shrine of Piercing Vision. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Shrine of the Forsaken Gods
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast colorless spells. Activate this ability only if you control seven or more lands.

editions.flavor: The gods known to the merfolk as Ula, Emeria, and Cosi were nothing more than false memories of a monstrous trinity: the Eldrazi titans Ulamog, Emrakul, and Kozilek.
The gods known to the merfolk as Ula, Emeria, and Cosi were nothing more than false memories of a monstrous trinity: the Eldrazi titans Ulamog, Emrakul, and Kozilek.

name: Shrink
text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The smallest beast can yet have the greatest heart."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse

name: Shrivel
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Have you ever killed insects nibbling at your crops? I think that's what the Eldrazi believe they're doing to us."
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

"Have you ever killed insects nibbling at your crops? I think that's what the Eldrazi believe they're doing to us."
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

"Do not weep for the frail. Their time couldn't have been that far off."
—Nathrac, plaguesower

name: Shriveling Rot
text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Shrouded Lore
text: Target opponent chooses a card in your graveyard. You may pay {B}. If you do, repeat this process except that opponent can't choose a card already chosen for Shrouded Lore. Then put the last chosen card into your hand.

name: Shrouded Serpent
text: Whenever Shrouded Serpent attacks, defending player may pay {4}. If he or she doesn't, Shrouded Serpent can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Many travelers have wandered into a fog only to find that it had teeth, claws, and an appetite.

name: Shu Cavalry
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.
In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

name: Shu Defender
text: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

name: Shu Elite Companions
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."
Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."
Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

name: Shu Farmer
text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
—A Shu diplomat
Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

name: Shu General
text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

name: Shu Grain Caravan
text: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

name: Shuko
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Equip {0} ({0}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"One scratch on a wall meant safe passage, two that the target had already been raided, and three warned of a trap."
—Weaponry of Kamigawa

name: Shunt
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

editions.flavor: "You might want to work on your aim."
Aranghil held her fury in her heart, hard and bright as a ruby. With its razor edge, she rewrote the laws of battle.

name: Shuriken
text:
Equipped creature has "{T}, Unattach Shuriken: Shuriken deals 2 damage to target creature. That creature's controller gains control of Shuriken unless it was unattached from a Ninja."
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
text: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.
During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

name: Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {R/W}{R/W}. If you do, target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

name: Shyft
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Sibilant Spirit
text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.

editions.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald
She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

name: Sibsig Host
text: When Sibsig Host enters the battlefield, each player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"They were your friends, your family, your clan. They want only to welcome you."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

name: Sibsig Icebreakers
text: When Sibsig Icebreakers enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"I almost envy them. They can't get frostbite."
—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

name: Sibsig Muckdraggers
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
When Sibsig Muckdraggers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Sick and Tired
text: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Phyrexians' only interest in organic life is discerning its weakness.

name: Sicken
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: Urza dared to attack Phyrexia. Slowly, it retaliated.

name: Sickening Dreams
text:
As an additional cost to cast Sickening Dreams, discard X cards.
Sickening Dreams deals X damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: The Patriarch dreams of vile plague.
The Patriarch dreams of vile plague.

name: Sickening Shoal
text:
You may exile a black card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Sickening Shoal's mana cost.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

name: Sickle Ripper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.
His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.

name: Sickleslicer
Sidar Jabari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Sidar Jabari attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

editions.flavor:
"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed."
—Sidar Jabari

"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Sidar Kondo
text: {3}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Kondo served as guardian to the infant Gerrard and raised him alongside his own son, Vuel. He taught both boys to be strong and to lead, but whereas Gerrard became a champion of honor, Vuel's bitterness led him to become an equally devastating force of malice.

name: Sidar Kondo of Jamuraa
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Creatures your opponents control without flying or reach can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

name: Sideswipe
text: You may change any targets of target Arcane spell.

editions.flavor: Hisoka's wizards struggled for years to master the art of redirection that came so naturally to the shamans of Ganzan Pass.

name: Side to Side
text: You and target opponent arm-wrestle. If you win, put a 3/3 green Ape creature token into play.

editions.flavor: His friends at the gym never knew Garanth's secret shame. For years he had tried to walk away from professional arm wrestling, but hey—free monkeys.

name: Sidewinder Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have flanking. (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks a Sliver, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"They encircled our patrol with the stealth of snakes, corralling us like livestock."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Sidisi, Brood Tyrant
text:
Whenever Sidisi, Brood Tyrant enters the battlefield or attacks, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
Whenever one or more creature cards are put into your graveyard from your library, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Sidisi's Faithful
text:
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Sidisi's Faithful exploits a creature, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "I tire of your prattle, and your face."

name: Sidisi's Pet
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Morph {1}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: The Sultai distinguish between pet and slave by the material of the chain.

text:
Deathtouch
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Sidisi, Undead Vizier exploits a creature, you may search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Siege Behemoth
text:
Hexproof
As long as Siege Behemoth is attacking, for each creature you control, you may have that creature assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

editions.flavor:
"Hold the line, hold the li—"
—General Srok, last words

name: Siegecraft
text:
Enchant creature

editions.flavor:
"They thought their fortress impregnable . . . until we marched up with ours, and blocked out the sun."
—Golran, dragonscale captain

name: Siege Dragon
text:
Flying
When Siege Dragon enters the battlefield, destroy all Walls your opponents control.
Whenever Siege Dragon attacks, if defending player controls no Walls, it deals 2 damage to each creature without flying that player controls.

text:

editions.flavor:
"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."

Enchant creature or Vehicle

Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.

editions.flavor: Perfect for getting through to the consuls.

name: Siege of Towers
text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

text:
Trample

name: Siege Wurm
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

editions.flavor: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

name: Sift
text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem
Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool." ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Sift Through Sands
text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
If you've cast a spell named Peer Through Depths and a spell named Reach Through Mists this turn, you may search your library for a card named The Unspeakable, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

text:
Flying

text:
Flying, hexproof

editions.flavor: Great devotion yields great reward.

name: Sigarda's Aid
text:
You may cast Aura and Equipment spells as though they had flash.
Whenever an Equipment enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach it to target creature you control.

editions.flavor: The Order of Saint Traft found new strength with Sigarda's support.

name: Sigardian Priest
text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.

editions.flavor: Many whose faith was destroyed by Avacyn turned to the only angel who remained true to humanity.

name: Sight Beyond Sight
text:
Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

text:

{U}: Sighted-Caste Sorcerer gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Sightless Ghoul can't block.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

name: Sight of the Scalelords
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, creatures you control with toughness 4 or greater get +2/+2 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The Silumgar creep around our borders and infiltrate our aeries. We must remain ever watchful."
—Golran, Dromoka captain

name: Sigil Blessing
text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +3/+3 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.

First strike
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
